name: Test User Creation
sql: INSERT INTO Users (username, password, email, role) VALUES ('testuser', 'securepassword', 'testuser@example.com', 'admin');
rationale: To verify that a new user can be successfully created.

name: Test Unique Username Constraint in Users
sql: INSERT INTO Users (username, password, email, role) VALUES ('testuser', 'securepassword', 'anotheruser@example.com', 'user');
rationale: To check that a username must be unique in the Users table.

name: Test Department Creation
sql: INSERT INTO Departments (name, manager_id) VALUES ('Sales', 1);
rationale: To verify that a new department can be successfully created with a manager.

name: Test Unique Department Name Constraint
sql: INSERT INTO Departments (name, manager_id) VALUES ('Sales', 2);
rationale: To ensure that department names are unique.

name: Test Product Creation
sql: INSERT INTO Products (name, description, price, stock_quantity) VALUES ('Laptop', 'A high-end laptop', 1200.00, 10);
rationale: To verify that a new product can be successfully created.

name: Test Unique Product Name Constraint
sql: INSERT INTO Products (name, description, price, stock_quantity) VALUES ('Laptop', 'Another laptop', 1000.00, 5);
rationale: To check that product names must be unique.

name: Test Order Creation
sql: INSERT INTO Orders (user_id, status, total) VALUES (1, 'Pending', 100.00);
rationale: To verify that an order can be successfully created.

name: Test User Foreign Key Constraint in Orders
sql: INSERT INTO Orders (user_id, status, total) VALUES (999, 'Pending', 100.00);
rationale: To ensure that user_id must refer to an existing user.

name: Test Supplier Creation
sql: INSERT INTO Suppliers (name, contact_email, phone_number, address) VALUES ('Tech Supplies', 'contact@techsupplies.com', '123-456-7890', '123 Tech Lane');
rationale: To verify that a new supplier can be created.

name: Test Unique Supplier Name Constraint
sql: INSERT INTO Suppliers (name, contact_email, phone_number, address) VALUES ('Tech Supplies', 'another@techsupplies.com', '098-765-4321', '456 Tech Lane');
rationale: To check that supplier names must be unique.

name: Test Order Item Creation
sql: INSERT INTO Order_Items (order_id, product_id, quantity, price) VALUES (1, 1, 2, 1200.00);
rationale: To verify that an order item can be successfully created.

name: Test Foreign Key Constraint in Order Items
sql: INSERT INTO Order_Items (order_id, product_id, quantity, price) VALUES (999, 1, 1, 1200.00);
rationale: To ensure order_id must refer to an existing order.

name: Test Sales Invoice Creation
sql: INSERT INTO Sales_Invoices (order_id, total_amount) VALUES (1, 100.00);
rationale: To verify that a sales invoice can be successfully created.

name: Test Foreign Key Constraint in Sales Invoices
sql: INSERT INTO Sales_Invoices (order_id, total_amount) VALUES (999, 100.00);
rationale: To ensure order_id must refer to an existing order.

name: Test Purchase Invoice Creation
sql: INSERT INTO Purchase_Invoices (supplier_id, total_amount) VALUES (1, 500.00);
rationale: To verify that a purchase invoice can be successfully created.

name: Test Foreign Key Constraint in Purchase Invoices
sql: INSERT INTO Purchase_Invoices (supplier_id, total_amount) VALUES (999, 500.00);
rationale: To ensure supplier_id must refer to an existing supplier.

name: Test Purchase Order Creation
sql: INSERT INTO Purchase_Orders (supplier_id, user_id, status, total) VALUES (1, 1, 'Pending', 300.00);
rationale: To verify that a purchase order can be successfully created.

name: Test Foreign Key Constraints in Purchase Orders
sql: INSERT INTO Purchase_Orders (supplier_id, user_id, status, total) VALUES (999, 999, 'Pending', 300.00);
rationale: To ensure both supplier_id and user_id must refer to existing records.

name: Test Purchase Order Item Creation
sql: INSERT INTO Purchase_Order_Items (purchase_order_id, product_id, quantity, price) VALUES (1, 1, 10, 1200.00);
rationale: To verify that a purchase order item can be successfully created.

name: Test Foreign Key Constraints in Purchase Order Items
sql: INSERT INTO Purchase_Order_Items (purchase_order_id, product_id, quantity, price) VALUES (999, 1, 10, 1200.00);
rationale: To ensure purchase_order_id must refer to an existing purchase order.
